chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Vande Boom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jennifer M Vande Boom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jennifer M Vande Boom was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to victim due within first 3 months of supervision.
Restitution to Crime Victim Comp. due within following 6 months of supervision.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Court costs due in 20 days. Failure to pay 1 day jail for every $25 owed.
No occupation providing childcare during period of supervision.
Counseling and follow-up as deemed appropriate by agent.
Parties agree to Read-In:  DA #14-1522 Child Licensing Violation on or about 9/12/15.

Defendant Jennifer M Vande Boom in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionaire filed. Amended information filed. Court renders sentence. Jury trial removed from court calendar.

records.addlTxt: State by ADA Patti Wabitsch.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty John Schiro in person.  Court advises of the penalties.  Counsel waives reading.  Court discloses familiarity with relationships with the defendant's family and will recuse self.  State requesting $1000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $5000 signature bond w/conditions: not to operate a Day Care Business; No contact with LS or PS or their children; no unsupervised contact with anyone under age 18 except own children.  Court examines on preliminary hearing.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Parties will be notified of next court date.
